results.title: Foothold on Antarctica
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide Pictures and British Information Services
results.brief_description: As a preliminary to the crossing of the Antarctic continent by Sir Vivian Fuchs and his party, an advance group set out from London in the m.v. “Theron”, a Canadian sealing vessel, to establish a base camp. Her month long struggle with the pack ice of the Weddell Sea captured the attention of the world. This film, a record of that journey, received Honourable Mention at the International Festival of Documentary and Expeprimental Cinema, Montevideo, 1958.

results.title: Fools rush in
results.creator_credit: Andy Tennant, Doug Draizin and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Alex Whitman is a high-flying New York yuppie sent by his company to open a nightclub in Las Vegas. It is a reluctant move for him, though once there, he meets the beautiful Mexican photographer, Isabel Fuentes. Though opposites in nearly every way, romantic sparks fly and the two have a passionate one night stand. Three months later, Isabel shows up pregnant with his child and every intention of keeping it. The two hastily marry in a Vegas chapel while an Elvis impersonator acts as the witness. A head-on collision of cultures ensues, prompting the contemplation of a break-up. A large family gathering, planned by Isabel, grows larger due to surprise family guests, thus creating a comedy of errors before the story draws to its predictable romantic close. Cast includes Matthew Perry, Salma Hayek, Jon Tenney, Carlos Gomez and Tomas Milian.

results.title: Flubber
results.creator_credit: Les Mayfield, Ricardo Mestres, John Hughes, Great Oaks and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: In this colourful remake of ‘The Absent Minded Professor’ (1961), Robin Williams plays Professor Philip Brainard, a brilliant off the wall inventor with an unfortunate short term memory. Flubber, his latest creation is a green rubber-like substance, which has the capacity to give objects flight. Potentially a gold mine for the professor and his college (which is near bankruptcy), the invention receives the unwelcome attention of Brainard’s spiteful nemesis Wilson Croft (Christopher McDonald), who has his own plans for the gravity-defying matter. The romantic subplot which involves a bizarre love triangle between Brainard, his long suffering fiance Sara (Marcia Gay Harden), and a female robot with a jealous streak called Weebo (Jodi Benson), give the film some surprisingly poignant moments, mainly due to Harden’s tender performance. Music by Danny Elfman and screenplay by John Hughes and Bill Walsh.

results.title: Flashdance
results.creator_credit: Adrian Lyne, Jerry Bruckheimer, Don Simpson, Paramount Pictures and PolyGram
results.brief_description: Flashdance is the story of Alex Owens, a fiercely determined 18 year old who is a Pittsburgh steel-mill welder by day, and a bar dancer by night. We follow her struggle to gain independence, find love, and to realise her dream for a career in modern dance. Includes music by Giorgio Moroder. Cast includes Jennifer Beals, Michael Nouri, Lilia Skala, Sunny Johnson and Kyle Heffner.

results.title: Fitzcarraldo
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog, Lucki Stipetic and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: An intense and enthralling portrait of an intrepid and obsessed impresario with a desire to bring both Enrico Caruso and an opera house to the deepest jungles of South America. The highlight of the story is Fitzcarraldo’s Herculean effort to haul a 300-plus ton steamboat over the mountains, for which no trickery was used in filming the gruelling sequence. Director Werner Herzog boldly embarked on the same journey, proving to be as driven and single-purposed as his protagonist, the audience’s knowledge of this adding to the excitement. In German with English subtitles. Cast includes Klaus Kinski, Claudia Cardinale, Jose Lewgoy, Miguel Angel Fuentes and Paul Hittscher.

results.title: Fire over England
results.creator_credit: William K. Howard, Erich Pommer, Pendennis and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: Historical drama dealing with England’s struggle against the Spanish Armada. Performances by Vivien Leigh, Laurence Olivier, Flora Robson and an early performance by James Mason. Based on the novel by A.E.W. Mason.

results.title: Finding Nemo
results.creator_credit: Andrew Stanton, Graham Walters, Walt Disney Pictures and Pixar Animation Studios
results.brief_description: When Nemo, a young clownfish, is unexpectedly carried far from home, his father Marlin, and Dory, a friendly but forgetful regal blue tang fish embark on an epic journey. Features the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem DaFoe, Brad Garrett.

results.title: Fight club
results.creator_credit: David Fincher, Ross Grayson Bell, Cean Chaffin, Art Linson, Linson Films, Regency Enterprises and Fox 2000
results.brief_description: Edward Norton is Jack, a young urban professional with the right job, the right furniture and the right bank account who is so bored and filled with self-disgust at his vapid consumerism that he attends support-groups for people dying from various diseases in order to experience some form of human contact. Jack’s life is turned upside down when he meets Tyler Durden (Brad Pitt) who introduces him to the “fight club”, a secret society of men who meet in underground clubs to beat the pulp out of each other. Before long Jack, under the influence of the magnetic Tyler Durden, finds himself commandeering a terrorist organisation committed to smashing the American corporate state. Based on Chuck Palahniuk’s cult novel, director David Fincher deploys a swirling, kinetic and audacious mise-en-scene to represent the fragmented and hyper-alienated psychology of contemporary American society. Though the violence in the film is extreme, “Fight Club” is a highly satirical commentary on machismo and masculine insecurity. On its release “Fight Club” was severely criticised for its elusive and contradictory politics; but contradiction is the essence of the society that the film examines. So this is a virulently anti-Capitalist movie financed by one of the world’s largest media multinationals; this is a feminist film that exalts in masculine aggression; this is a film that postulates that materialism has gone too far while utilising every state-of-the-art digital special effect available. It is always, however, exhilarating and provocative. Cast includes Meat Loaf, Jared Leto and Helena Bonham Carter (terrific as Jack’s resilient chain-smoking s ometimes-girlfriend, Marla). Original soundtrack by The Dust Brothers.

results.title: Field of dreams
results.creator_credit: Phil Alden Robinson, Charles Gordon, Lawrence Gordon and Gordon Company
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “Shoeless Joe” by W. P. Kinsella, this is the story of one man’s quest to transform vision to reality. “If you build it, he will come” is the ethereal message that inspires Iowa farmer Ray Kinsella (Kevin Costner) to construct a baseball diamond in the middle of his cornfield. At first “he” seems to be the ghost of disgraced ballplayer “Shoeless” Joe Jackson (Ray Liotta), who materialises on the ballfield and plays a few games with the awestruck Ray. However he gradually he comes to realise that his ballfield has been divinely ordained to give a second chance to people who have sacrificed certain valuable aspects of their lives, including a Salingeresque writer (James Earl Jones) and Doc Graham (Burt Lancaster), who gave up a promising career in baseball in favour of medicine. The film is a celebration of the love of baseball.

results.title: Fetishes
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Broomfield, Michele D'Acosta and Home Box Office
results.brief_description: Pandora’s Box is an exclusive high class S & M parlour in Manhattan. Mistress Raven - previously a Long Island housewife, became New York’s most famous mistress and later retired to become the founder of Pandora’s Box. The documentary covers the functions of her parlour and various aspects of S & M; corporal punishment, whipping/slapping, wrestling fetish, rubber fetish, infantilism, slaves, humiliation, mistresses etc. The documentary provides insights into the personal aspirations of Raven’s crew of dominatrix (Mistress Natasha, Catherine, and Delilah) with vivid footage of the parlour in operation.
